result.execSummary:
Samuel Walton was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Samuel Walton was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Walton

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:49 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Johnathan Barnett.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila.   

Date and time set for extradition hearing. 
Reading waived.  
COURT recites history of matter from yesterday; Defendant is still willing to waive extradition. 

Defendant signs Extradition Waiver in front of Court.  
COURT signs Certification of Judge.  

Adj:  2:53 p.m.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:37 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Ben Verchinski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila. 

Date and time set for initial appearance/Extradition.
COURT recites extradition warrant for parties; 
Atty Avila states deft is willing to waive extradition and return to Mississippi. 
COURT questions defendant re extradition; Defendant makes statement.
COURT advises jail officer to have defendant be brought in person to sign waiver in front of Court. 

COURT resets matter for 7/26/22 at 2:00 p.m.  

Adj:  2:40 p .m.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:16 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty John Mathie. 
Atty Mathie notes he was unable to meet with deft today. 
COURT questions deft regarding proceeding without counsel. 
Deft states wish to have counsel. 
State requests cash bond. 

COURT ORDERS: $5000 cash bond. 

IA reset to 7/25/2022 at 2:00 pm in Br. 4.
